<small>Aramaic form: [[H1693]]</small>
 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּבַק‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּבֵק‎</span> **verb** ==cling, cleave, keep close== (Late Hebrew ***id.***, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דְּבֵק‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דְּבַק‎</span> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">) — 

**Qal** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּבַק‎</span> [[1Kgs.11.2|1Kgs 11:2]] + 2 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְדָבַק‎</span> consecutive [[Gen.2.24|Gen 2:24]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּבֵ֑ק‎</span> [[2Kgs.3.3|2Kgs 3:3]] 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּֽבְקָה‎</span> [[Ruth.1.14|Ruth 1:14]] + 5 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּבֵ֑קָה‎</span> [[Job.29.10|Job 29:10]] 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּבַקְתִּי‎</span> [[Ps.119.31|Ps 119:31]] 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּֽבְקוּ‎</span> [[2Sam.20.2|2Sam 20:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְדָֽבְקוּ‎</span> consecutive [[Deut.28.60|Deut 28:60]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּבֵ֑קוּ‎</span> [[Job.41.15|Job 41:15]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּדְבַקְתֶּם‎</span> consecutive [[Josh.23.12|Josh 23:12]] ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִדְבַּק‎</span> [[Deut.13.18|Deut 13:18]] + 3 t.; 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּדְבַּק‎</span> [[2Kgs.5.27|2Kgs 5:27]]; [[Ps.137.6|Ps 137:6]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתִּדְבַּק‎</span> [[Gen.34.3|Gen 34:3]] + 2 t.; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּדְבָּקַנִי‎</span> [[Gen.19.19|Gen 19:19]] 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּדְבָּ֑ק‎</span> [[Deut.10.20|Deut 10:20]]; [[Ezek.29.4|Ezek 29:4]] (strike out [[BDB#B|B]] [[BDB#Co|Co]]); 2 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּדְבָּקִין‎</span> [[Ruth.2.8|Ruth 2:8]]; [[Ruth.2.21|Ruth 2:21]] 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִדְבְּקוּ‎</span> [[Num.36.7|Num 36:7]]; [[Num.36.9|Num 36:9]] 2 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּדְבָּ֑קוּ‎</span> [[Josh.23.8|Josh 23:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּדְבָּקוּ֑ן‎</span> [[Deut.13.5|Deut 13:5]] ***Infinitive construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּלְדָבְקָהבּֿוֺ‎</span> [[Deut.11.22|Deut 11:22]] + 2 t.; — in Hexateuch only [[BDB#J|J]] [[BDB#D|D]], except [[Num.36.7|Num 36:7]]; [[Num.36.9|Num 36:9]] ([[BDB#P|P]]); — 

**1.** ***cling, cleave to***, 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** literally followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> [[Job.19.20|Job 19:20]] (bone to skin), so followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> [[Ps.102.6|Ps 102:6]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> [[2Sam.23.10|2Sam 23:10]] (hand to sword; accidentally omitted with other words [[1Chr.11.13|1Chr 11:13]] compare [[BDB#Dr|Dr]] [[2Sam.23.11|2Sam 23:11]]), [[Jer.13.11|Jer 13:11]] (girdle to loins), [[Lam.4.4|Lam 4:4]] (tongue to roof of mouth, in thirst), so followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> [[Job.29.10|Job 29:10]]; [[Ps.137.6|Ps 137:6]] (as a judgment); so also in metaphor [[Ps.44.26|Ps 44:26]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּֽבְקָה לָאָרֶץ בִּטְנֵנוּ‎</span> ***our belly cleaveth to the earth*** (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁחָה לֶעָפָר נַפְשֵׁנוּ‎</span>), [[Ps.119.25|Ps 119:25]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּֽבְקָה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֶעָפָר נַפְשִׁי‎</span>; fish to scales of crocodile (figurative of Pharaoh), followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> [[Ezek.29.4|Ezek 29:4]] (but compare above); absolute (reciprocal) of folds of crocodile's belly [[Job.41.15|Job 41:15]] further of the <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חֵרֶם‎</span> remaining in (***sticking to***) the hand followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> [[Deut.13.18|Deut 13:18]] so of spot, stain [[Job.31.7|Job 31:7]] 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** so also of abiding on the land of one's tribe [[Num.36.7|Num 36:7]]; [[Num.36.9|Num 36:9]] (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span>). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** = ***remain with, close to*** followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִם‎</span> [[Ruth.2.8|Ruth 2:8]]; [[Ruth.2.21|Ruth 2:21]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> v[[Ruth.2.23|Ruth 2:23]]. 

**2.** ***cling, cleave to***, 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** figurative of loyalty, affection etc., sometimes with idea of physical proximity retained, followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> [[Gen.2.24|Gen 2:24]] ([[BDB#J|J]]; man to wife) compare [[Gen.34.3|Gen 34:3]] ([[BDB#J|J]]) [[1Kgs.11.2|1Kgs 11:2]]; [[Josh.23.12|Josh 23:12]] ([[BDB#D|D]]); further [[Ruth.1.14|Ruth 1:14]] (Ruth to Naomi); [[2Sam.20.2|2Sam 20:2]] (people to king); especially (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span>) of cleaving to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> [[Deut.11.22|Deut 11:22]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָהֵב‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָלַךְ בְּכָלדְּֿרָכָיו‎</span>) [[Deut.30.20|Deut 30:20]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָהֵב‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁמַע בְּקֹלוֺ‎</span>), [[Josh.22.5|Josh 22:5]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָהֵב‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָלַךְ וגו‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׁמַר מִצְוֺתָיו‎</span>); compare further [[Deut.10.20|Deut 10:20]]; [[Deut.13.5|Deut 13:5]]; [[Josh.23.8|Josh 23:8]] (all [[BDB#D|D]]), [[2Kgs.18.6|2Kgs 18:6]]; [[Ps.63.9|Ps 63:9]] (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַחֲרֵי‎</span>) &amp; [[Ps.119.31|Ps 119:31]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎דָּבַקְתּי בְֵעדְוֺתֶ֑יךָ‎</span>; so 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** of the opposite <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּחַטּאֹות יָָֽרָבְעָם ֗֗֗ דָּבֵ֑ק‎</span> [[2Kgs.3.37|2Kgs 3:37]], 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** subject disease, calamity, followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> person [[Deut.28.60|Deut 28:60]]; [[2Kgs.5.27|2Kgs 5:27]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַחֲרֵי‎</span> [[Jer.42.16|Jer 42:16]] followed by accusative [[Gen.19.19|Gen 19:19]] ([[BDB#J|J]]); subject sin [[Ps.101.3|Ps 101:3]] (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> person) **Pu\`al** ***Imperfect*** 3 masculine plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יְדֻבָּ֑קוּ‎</span> passive of Hiph\`il **1** followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span>, of crocodile's scales, ***they are joined together*** [[Job.41.9|Job 41:9]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יִתְלַכְּדוּ‎</span>); absolute of earth-clods [[Job.38.38|Job 38:38]]. **Hiph\`il** ***Perfect*** 3 feminine singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִדְבִּיקָ֑תְהוּ‎</span> [[Judg.20.42|Judg 20:42]] 3 plural suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִדְבִּיקֻהוּ‎</span> [[2Sam.1.6|2Sam 1:6]] 1 singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִדְבַּקְתִּי‎</span> [[Jer.13.11|Jer 13:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהִדְבַּקְתִּ֫י‎</span> [[Ezek.29.4|Ezek 29:4]] ***Imperfect*** jussive <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַדְבֵּק‎</span> [[Deut.28.21|Deut 28:21]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּדְבֵּק‎</span> [[Gen.31.23|Gen 31:23]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַדְבִּיק‎</span> [[Ezek.3.26|Ezek 3:26]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּדְבִּיקוּ‎</span> [[Judg.18.22|Judg 18:22]]; [[Judg.20.45|Judg 20:45]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּדְבְּקוּ‎</span> [[1Sam.14.22|1Sam 14:22]] + 2 t. (compare [[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:53»§ 53</sup> R 4 [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>i. 210</sup>). 

**1.** ***cause to cling*** or ***cleave*** to, followed by accusative + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span>, literally <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּלְשׁוֺנְךָ אַדְבִּיק אֶלחִֿכֶּ֑ךָ‎</span> [[Ezek.3.26|Ezek 3:26]] see also [[Ezek.29.4|Ezek 29:4]] (followed by accusative + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span>; literal, but in metaphor); figurative of causing to cleave to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> [[Jer.13.11|Jer 13:11]] (followed by accusative + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span>); compare further [[Deut.28.21|Deut 28:21]] (subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>, followed by accusative of disease + <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span>). 

**2.** ***pursue closely***, followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַחֲרֵי‎</span> [[Judg.20.45|Judg 20:45]]; [[1Sam.14.22|1Sam 14:22]]; [[1Chr.10.2|1Chr 10:2]] = [[1Sam.31.2|1Sam 31:2]] (followed by accusative); so also [[2Sam.1.6|2Sam 1:6]] (followed by accusative) 

**3.** ***overtake***, followed by accusative [[Gen.31.23|Gen 31:23]] ([[BDB#E|E]]), [[Judg.18.22|Judg 18:22]] compare [[Judg.20.42|Judg 20:42]] (subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמִּלְחָמַה‎</span>). **Hoph\`al** ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּלְשׁוֺנִי מֻדְבָּק מַלְקוֺחָ֑י‎</span> [[Ps.22.16|Ps 22:16]] ***and my tongue is made to cleave (to) my gums***; compare below 

**Qal 1.**
